oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Interview with Bernard Stofel, July 29, 1989 describing shooting during the riots
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Excerpt from an interview with Bernard Stofel, July 29, 1989 conducted by Gail Williams O'Brien as part of her research for the book _The Color of the Law: Race, Violence, and Justice in the Post World War II South_. In the clip Stofel is describing how he and other officers were fired upon and shot during the riot in Columbia.
Bernard Stofel is a former police officer in Columbia, TN who was on duty at the time of the riot.
